1.Pros: There's was barely anything good to say about them. There was a manager who always tried to make sure we were doing the right and when we did, he rewarded us with trips.
1.Cons: Lazy coworkers, whom was always saying that's not my job when it came to cleaning. People were barely working.

2.Summary: "Great company. Great Brand to work for!"
2.Cons: Restructuring, Business decisions sometimes force difficult decisions

3.Cons: They have a hard time finding reliable help.

4.Pros: Literally no pros. Just the fact that you have a job. Other than that, the location I worked at was terrible.
4.Cons: Terrible managers. Rude, condescending, aggressive, and terrible leadership skills. Managers at my location were always gossiping about team members and always yelled at customers.

5.Pros: You learn customer service skills, and how to manage being treated like crap.
5.Cons: Everything. You WILL be discriminated against, and unless you can actually get in contact with a representative for Mcdonalds that has no direct affiliation with your owner, you won't ever be heard. Good Luck. That is pretty much why Mcdonalds is considered a joke.

6.Pros: There is good pay at $15 and I got free drinks, because drinks are hard to count for
6.Cons: It is a very fast-paced environment and drains a lot out of you; and of course many rude and downright crazy customers

7.Pros: Weekly pay30 minute breaks2 days off a wek

8.Pros: It's a job the team was great. Decent hours that's always nice. Wasn't so bad and vibes were good
8.Cons: Pay could of been better, managent could of been better needs improvement and stuff

9.Pros: Not as bad as people think. Just a regular food service job.
9.Cons: management could be inflexible at times.
